result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on January 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.

04:01 PM Defendant Naul Isiah Cruz appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Christina G. Petros appeared by phone for Naul Isiah Cruz.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Information previously eFiled, reading waived, NG plea entered. 950/Marsy's Law complied with.
Scheduling conference scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.

2:02 PM Defendant Naul Isiah Cruz in court, in custody.  Attorney Christina G. Petros in court for Naul Isiah Cruz.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Det. R. Rupnik sworn and testified, witness IDS deft in courtroom. Court finds probable cause, bound over. Defense requests an arraignment date and sent documentation to the State they will need to review. 950/Marsy's Law complied with.
Arraignment scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
